alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Lubbock. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 626 PM CDT, The threat of heavy rainfall has ended across the advisory area but minor flooding from prior rainfall is occurring. Between 0.1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Residual runoff is expected to continue through 8PM. - This will be the last statement on this event unless conditions warrant otherwise. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lubbock, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Lubbock International Airport, Woodrow, Reese Center, New Deal, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
